meta.description: Disallow unnecessary concatenation of literals or template literals

content.introduction:
Disallow unnecessary concatenation of literals or template literals
❄️FrozenThis rule is currentlyfrozenand is not accepting feature requests.
Table of ContentsRule DetailsWhen Not To Use ItVersionResources
It’s unnecessary to concatenate two strings together, such as:
constfoo="a"+"b";1Copy code to clipboard
This code is likely the result of refactoring where a variable was removed from the concatenation (such as"a" + b + "b"). In such a case, the concatenation isn’t important and the code can be rewritten as:
constfoo="ab";1Copy code to clipboard
